profile.name: Antonio
profile.title: IT professional
profile.description:
Currently supporting the web development teams at El Corte Inglés, within the Platform Assurance team.

I began my career providing IT technical support to the store staff of the Supercor and Sfera companies of the El Corte Inglés group. Later I joined the distributed systems operations team of the same group of companies.

In 2019 I left the operations department to join the Platform Assurance team as a support technician for the development teams of the e-commerce websites (elcortingles.es, hipercor.es, sfera.com, primeriti.es, etc.). At the same time being a systems technician for the development environments and infrastructure project manager for the new developments that the client needed.

Since then I have been dedicated in various stages to DevOps and DevSecOps support teams, working in the administration of Openshift and ELK platforms, or helping with the implementation of new CI/CD flows for the development teams.

In April 2024, I obtained the Atlassian ACP-620 certification for project management with Jira Software Cloud.

location.notes: Autocompleted using Google Maps API (id: ChIJd_LANWMvQg0RGYggE7EPcZM)

challenges.description:
Collaborate on a day-to-day basis with the client's development teams as an SRE, providing system support in previous environments, helping to improve application monitoring and observability, and assisting with the assembly of performance tests for them.

Assembly of development environments for Frontend applications on the Openshift container platform, requesting the registration of apps and their corresponding CI/CD flows, and validating said environments.

Performing support functions for development teams, helping with application deployment tasks, handling new CI/CD flows, proposing improvements in monitoring and observability, and liaising with systems teams in cases of resolving incidents in previous environments.

* Openshift cluster administration.
* Troubleshooting of incidents in Openshift infrastructure.
* Administration and management of users in the ELK monitoring stack.

As a side project within the team, I was asked to create a Python script to collect information on the different Openshift clusters that we managed and generate an Excel report with information regarding the number of nodes per cluster, pods and active projects.

Requirements gathering and response to requests from web development teams (via Jira), to transfer these needs to the information systems teams (via ticketing in Smart IT/BMC), who must provide the solutions that developers request, such as:

* Processing the corresponding requests for:

- New infrastructure registration, On-Premise or Cloud (Azure)
- Opening ports and setting up load balances in F5
- Creating site-to-site VPNs between companies
- User registration in pre-existing LDAP groups

* Designing and implementing Bash scripts to cover ad hoc project needs.

* Checking and monitoring infrastructures in non-production environments.

* Deploying applications in non-production environments.

Since April 2019, my main role is to take requirements and attend to requests from web development teams (via Jira), to transfer those needs to the information systems teams (via ticketing in Smart IT/BMC), who must provide the solutions that developers request, such as:

* Process the corresponding requests for:
- New infrastructure registration, On Premise or Cloud (Azure)
- Opening ports and setting up load balances in F5
- Opening requests for the creation of site-to-site VPNs between companies to the Security groups.
- User registration in pre-existing LDAP groups

* Design and implement Bash scripts to cover ad hoc project needs.

* Checking and monitoring infrastructures in non-productive environments.

* Deployment of applications in non-productive environments.

Monitoring and operation of online and batch processes and alerts related to Operating Systems (AIX, Windows) or Database Managers (Oracle) on servers distributed in Shopping Centers of the ECI Group of companies.

First-level support for several group companies (Supercor, Sfera, Supercor Express, Opencor, Telecor, etc.) and telephone support for the Sephora Business Partner.

details.name: Editor for DSLab blog
details.description: Among several coworkers, we decided to launch a side project in the form of a blog. There we wrote articles on various topics, from technical things like installing a Ubuntu server to how to download an epub on your tablet.

details.name: Enable environment for Business
details.description:
Due to business needs, the client needed a "non-production" environment that could receive production data so that the marketing teams could validate the promotions and offers that would be published in the coming days in the campaigns they had designed.

The challenge was to finish a project that had been stalled for months for different reasons. It was my first assignment when I arrived at the Platform Assurance department. We had to automate the production data loading processes in this "non-production" environment.

The challenge was that while the production infrastructure was on-premise, the infrastructure for this business environment was in the cloud. Therefore, we had to use ad hoc processes first to perform the loading and then to tune the catalog loading and indexing processes in the business environment. As we had much less computing power and latency problems between the client's CPD and the Azure cloud, in addition to the ad hoc bash developments, we had to orchestrate actions with different systems and communications groups to make the relevant adjustments.

After 6 months of learning, we managed to deliver the environment and operate it from the department to carry out the data uploads necessary for each campaign. Today, the environment is still operational and has been developed by other colleagues who succeeded me in the department, thanks to the documentation we left at the time.

studies.name: ACP-620 Managing Jira Projects for Cloud

institution.name: Atlassian
institution.description: The Managing Jira Cloud Projects Certification builds on the professional's existing agile skills, with a focus on optimizing the power of Jira Software for their development teams. This credential is for scrum masters, project administrators, project leads and board administrators who can configure and automate Jira Software Scrum and Kanban projects for classic and next-gen.

manfredSpecificData.desiredJobDescription:
I currently work as a DevOps/SRE with an emphasis on automation, but the idea is to evolve, not to stop learning.

Any position that involves working on automating tasks, either through scripts in *Bash* or *Python* or with tools like Ansible -which, although I am less familiar with it, I think has become an industry standard for orchestrating different types of automation- attracts my attention a lot and I want to direct my career towards these technologies.
manfredSpecificData.goodPractices:
I always try to document everything I have done and that is going to be used by a colleague.

I have worked with *KANBAN* and *SCRUM* at different stages of my professional career.

I usually train myself via Udemy courses in new technologies and read books about *Clean code* or *TDD*, even if they are not in my field of action, to have a more general vision and understanding of the rest of the technology verticals such as development.

I also listen to podcasts on topics related to management, strategy, personal development, and science.
